data.body:
When I setting a negative value for a variable in shader the parser think that it is a subtraction!
float a = -1.0; // not work
to solve it I use
float a = 0.0-1.0; // freak

data.title: [BUILD] fix include paths in webp
data.body:
This commit fixes include paths in provided webp. Without it build system is using webp provided by system which may lead to bugs as #687 
Tested on Archlinux and OS X.

Oh, I see it was fixed a long time ago in #74 , but someone have broken it…

data.title: rewrite the ping pong game code:)
data.body:
When I learn godot follow the lesson(https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_2d).
I found that the ping pong game code can't work.So I rewrite the code and add some simple ai to it.
I hope it's useful to you to update the tutorial.:)

```
extends Node2D

# member variables here, example:
# var a=2
# var b="textvar"
var screen_size
var pad_size

var ball_speed = 80
var direction = Vector2(-1,0)
const PAD_SPEED = 150

func _ready():
    # Initalization here
    #pass
    screen_size = get_viewport_rect().size
    pad_size = get_node("LeftPat").get_texture().get_size()
    set_process(true)

func _process(delta):
    #check ball is on the game zone
    var ball_pos = get_node("Ball").get_pos()
    var left_rect = Rect2(get_node("LeftPat").get_pos() - pad_size / 2,pad_size)
    var right_rect = Rect2(get_node("RightPat").get_pos() - pad_size / 2,pad_size)
    ball_pos += direction * ball_speed * delta
    #zone check beyond zone ball will be replace at middle
    if((left_rect.has_point(ball_pos) and direction.x < 0) or (right_rect.has_point(ball_pos) and direction.x > 0)):
        direction.x = -direction.x
        if(ball_speed < 120):
            ball_speed *= 1.1
        direction.y = randf() * 2.0 - 1
        direction = direction.normalized()
    elif(ball_pos.x < -screen_size.x / 2 or ball_pos.x > screen_size.x / 2 or ball_pos.y < -screen_size.y / 2 or ball_pos.y > screen_size.y / 2):
        ball_pos = Vector2(0,0)
        direction = Vector2(-1,0)
    get_node("Ball").set_pos(ball_pos)
    #move left pad
    var left_pos = get_node("LeftPat").get_pos()
    if(left_pos.y > -screen_size.y / 2 and Input.is_action_pressed("left_move_up")):
        left_pos.y += -PAD_SPEED * delta
    if(left_pos.y < screen_size.y / 2 and Input.is_action_pressed("left_move_down")):
        left_pos.y += PAD_SPEED * delta
    get_node("LeftPat").set_pos(left_pos)
    #move right pad
    var right_pos = get_node("RightPat").get_pos()
    if(right_pos.y > -screen_size.y / 2 and Input.is_action_pressed("right_move_up")):
        right_pos.y += -PAD_SPEED * delta
    if(right_pos.y < screen_size.y / 2 and Input.is_action_pressed("right_move_down")):
        right_pos.y += PAD_SPEED * delta
    get_node("RightPat").set_pos(right_pos)
    #left ai
    left_pos = get_node("LeftPat").get_pos()
    if(left_pos.y < ball_pos.y and left_pos.x < ball_pos.x):
        left_pos.y += PAD_SPEED * delta
    elif(left_pos.y > ball_pos.y and left_pos.x < ball_pos.x):
        left_pos.y -= PAD_SPEED * delta
    get_node("LeftPat").set_pos(left_pos)
    #right ai
    right_pos = get_node("RightPat").get_pos()
    if(right_pos.y < ball_pos.y and right_pos.x > ball_pos.x):
        right_pos.y += PAD_SPEED * delta
    elif(right_pos.y > ball_pos.y and right_pos.x > ball_pos.x):
        right_pos.y -= PAD_SPEED * delta
    get_node("RightPat").set_pos(right_pos)
```

data.title: Problems with Unicode characters in editor on Linux.
data.body:
I've found a handful of issues with typing non-ascii Unicode characters into the text editor in Linux.

The first issue has to do with the compose key. The key appears to work, at least partially, but doesn't seem to always insert the correct character. For example: the sequence '..' should give me a '…', but instead gives me a '·'. Similarly I should be able to type '---' to get an emdash (—). But it stops a after the second '-', giving me an endash (–).

That issue, however, could be worked around by copying the character from another application (and would have to be done for some more unusual characters), but pasting the character into the editor results in an ugly escape sequence, even though the editor does support displaying Unicode characters.

And that leads to the final issue, the one that makes working with Unicode in the editor near impossible: GDScript doesn't support Unicode escape sequences. Using them results in "Parse error: Invalid escape sequence", even thought the documentation says that GDScript supports all C escape sequences.

I'm getting this error:

With these dependencies installed: 
- glu
- libxcursor
- alsa-lib
- freetype2

My distro is Parabola GNU/Linux-libre, the web server is down, but you can search the [Archlinux package repository](https://www.archlinux.org/packages/) for packages if you want to tell me to install any!

data.title: Invisible text in the editor with old AMD GPU on Windows 7
data.body:
(Sorry my english)
Hi, I come to report a bug godot in "Windows 7", the problem is that when you start godot text is not displayed or is "invisible", and and tried several ways to try to solve the problem (basic solutions) to update "Windows", compile godot (the latest github, gives the same problem), update directx,drivers, compatibility mode and some other (problem not solved).

data.title: Using ray casting to select faces
data.body:
http://www.moczys.com/webGL/Experiment_02_V05.html

Being able to select a face from a mesh, or collision shape could be a useful feature in godot, in this example they change face color, but I could imagine using the face to get uv information which can turn to pixel information, and having the ability to move an image around in a 2d scene.

data.title: Game crashes when used remote filesystem for resources.
Fixed typo and standardised spacing
Export shape keys to .dae as geometry
data.body:
This adds basic support for shape keys geometry objects.
It is added as hyerarchy, with shapes as childs of main object.

Some bugs can live here, but at least it works on my test objects.

This is first step to support exporting Blender shape keys as morph targets.
It was only tested on Blender 2.71.

data.title: Shader Lighting Code seems to get overwritten by Shader Fragment Code.
data.body: When I add some lighting code to a shader, and save, then reload the scene, the lighting code has become whatever the fragment shdaer code was. I assume this is either a bug or me being very stupid.

data.title: [Feature request] Option for changing draw order for TileMap nodes and Sprite nodes
data.body:
This feature is for 2D Zelda-like games. The draw order is not correct at all:

![03kvxun](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4111542/aab79102-320b-11e4-838a-74cb728e0eb6.png)

![x2ebhxd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4111546/c0a591ee-320b-11e4-8985-8b5fbec28cca.png)

![w6kd4s3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4111548/d0616c7a-320b-11e4-91bc-8813441c86d3.png)

I post this feature request since [my topic in the Godot forum](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=813#p3765) was forgotten :). I think Godot need this because the developer have to change dynamically the nodes order in the tree since Godot use the order of that tree to draw the objects in the game. This should be something already managed by the game engine, though. And also, the tiles are draw _weird_ in some cases were the tile is a composition of several tiles that forms an object like a tree or a rock.

data.title: Particle Random Startorientation
data.body:
It would be great to have a random start orientation for particles.
This may give some more variety in the look a particle system can look and doesn't look to repetitive.

data.title: After selecting multiple lines of code, Tabbing has glitch with first line & with intellisense popup.
data.body:
Select multiple lines of code starting at the very beginning of a line (before any tabs). Keep reselecting until no intellisense pops up. Press tab a few times. Press shift-tab a few times. This is how multi-line tabbing is suppose to work.

First glitch: Select multiple lines of code starting in the middle of at line of code.  Keep reselecting until no intellisense pops up. Press tab a few times. Press shift-tab a few times. The first line that is partially selected needs to be tabbed just like the rest of the lines.

Second glitch: Select multiple lines of code starting at the very beginning of a line (before any tabs) AND press tab once. Keep reselecting AND pressing tab once UNTIL intellisense DOES pops up. Press tab many times. Press shift-tab many times. The first (and ever odd) time you press tab, it either closes out of intellisense with no changes (if you did not press up or down) OR deletes most of the lines of code you were selecting (if you press up or down first). The second (and every even) time you press tab, it does the multi-line tabbing as you were expecting. Intellisense needs to be disabled whenever multiple lines are selected.

At some point (while ar trying to make drivers\libdrivers1.a) I get a cmd error, telling me that command line is too long.


There is no way I could solve it from a user's point of view, since I have no control on how command lines are built...

I'd be happy to help solving the problem if you tell me the steps.

data.title: user:// causing clutter
data.body:
A user:// directory is created for every game made or run in Godot, even if the game doesn't save any data. This results in a swath of empty directories. A project option to disable use of the user:// directory, and therefore creation of it, would be good.

Also, on Linux, these directories are created directly under the user's home directory. Should be elsewhere: http://standards.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

Furthermore, many companies group their game config dirs together under one company parent dir, typically in ~/ or ~/.config/ and an option to do this would go a long way towards reduction of clutter.

data.title: Exporting a node to a subscene loses the custom values of exported variables
data.body:
i am using commit: 89fa70706f9166765c3ac3f799225a467800f065

origin scene:
![2014-08-30 10 55 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2070604/4097974/4b678ca0-2ff1-11e4-90a9-3cf7052c51b8.png)

convert to subscene:
![2014-08-30 10 55 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2070604/4097975/5217896a-2ff1-11e4-8bcb-8f667078683e.png)
all script variables become default values

thank^^

data.title: debugger hint for .length is lacking
data.body:
When running the following code:

```
var a = ""
a.length
```

This error message displays:

```
Invalid get index 'length' (on base: 'String').
```

This message should be updated to: 

```
Invalid get index 'length' (on base: 'String'). Try using '.length()' instead of '.length'
```

data.title: Documentation does not say how to find number of characters in a string.
data.body:
Documentation does not say how to find number of characters in a string. Some languages give you the number of bites used by the string but that is not the command I am looking for. I need to know how many Unicode characters (not bytes) are in a string.

This should be in the string section of: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/gdscript#string

data.title: "Parse Error: Unterminated Comment" not checking for end of file.
data.body:
When having a comment as the last line of a script this error displays:

```
Parse Error: Unterminated Comment
```

The parser needs to check for <NewLine> or <End of File> before displaying this error.

data.title: Shader Language Issues
data.body: ==, and != operators do not evalute to a boolean for if statements.
